items.title: Ask HN: Do you find AI code review tools useful?
items.raw_excerpt: I'm struggling to understand how these tools are actually useful. The AI doesn't have the product knowledge to catch logic bugs, and basic tests should eliminate syntactic bugs/endless loops etc. Perhaps codebase indexing could help, although it still wouldn't be able to understand the "why" behind the code. Curious if others feel the same

title_i18n.en: Ask HN: Do you find AI code review tools useful?
title_i18n.zh: 问HN：你觉得AI代码审查工具有用吗？
title_i18n.es: Pregunta HN: ¿Encuentras útiles las herramientas de revisión de código con IA?

excerpt_i18n.en: I'm struggling to understand how these tools are actually useful. The AI doesn't have the product knowledge to catch logic bugs, and basic tests should eliminate syntactic bugs/endless loops etc. Perhaps codebase indexing could help, although it still wouldn't be able to understand the "why" behind the code. Curious if others feel the same
excerpt_i18n.zh: 我难以理解这些工具的实际用处。AI缺乏产品知识来捕捉逻辑错误，而基础测试本应能消除语法错误和无限循环等问题。或许代码库索引能解决部分问题。
excerpt_i18n.es: Me cuesta entender cómo estas herramientas son realmente útiles. La IA no tiene el conocimiento del producto para detectar errores de lógica, y las pruebas básicas deberían eliminar errores sintácticos/bucles infinitos, etc. Quizás la indexación de la base de código...

items.title: Ask HN: Share a video-series of developing non-trivial things with AI?
items.raw_excerpt: I often see claims like "Ya, AI was rather bad at developing features ~6 months ago, but now it's _actually_ good!". Every once in a while I go and try using it for more significant development work, but thus far I've been disappointed. Thus far for me, it's been great for brainstorming or making initial prototypes, but generally not good enough to ship a finished artifact that has to interact with other pieces. I don't want to waste time doing this test again. And maybe I'm just doing it wrong. If there is a video series of somebody using AI to develop something rather complex, I think that would be much better evidence than the usual unsupported claim, and it could show me what I'm doing wrong. I'm imagining this would be like a "Let's play" series, but for software development. If no su

items.title: Show HN: RapidFire AI: 16–24x More Experiment Throughput Without Extra GPUs
items.raw_excerpt: We built RapidFire AI, an open-source Python tool to speed up LLM fine-tuning and post-training with a powerful level of control not found in most tools: Stop, resume, clone-modify and warm-start configs on the fly—so you can branch experiments while they’re running instead of starting from scratch or running one after another. - Works within your OSS stack: PyTorch, HuggingFace TRL/PEFT), MLflow. - Hyperparallel search: launch as many configs as you want together, even on a single GPU - Dynamic real-time control: stop laggards, resume them later to revisit, branch promising configs in flight. - Deterministic eval + run tracking: Metrics curves are automatically plotted and are comparable. - Apache License v2.0: No vendor lock in. Develop on your IDE, launch from CLI. Repo: https://github.

items.raw_excerpt: Hey, it's Safwan I'm 16 and obsessed with AI and coding. Last year, I was struggling with my homework - especially when teachers gave us long PDF documents to analyze for history and literature classes. The problem? I'd spend hours scrolling through 30-page PDFs trying to find specific quotes or information for my essays. My friends had the same issue - we were all wasting time instead of actually learning. I tried Ctrl+F, highlighting, even printing everything out... but I realized what we really needed was to ask questions to our documents like we would to a teacher. So during summer break, I taught myself more about AI and built the first version of PDF Chat. Now I can finish my research in minutes instead of hours, and I'm helping students and professionals worldwide do the same. Prett

items.title: Launch HN: Strata (YC X25) – One MCP server for AI to handle thousands of tools
items.raw_excerpt: Hey HN! We are Klavis AI ( https://www.klavis.ai/ ) and we're launching Strata, one open-source MCP server that helps AI agents use thousands of API tools without getting overwhelmed. Instead of showing all available tools at once, Strata reveals them step-by-step based on what the AI actually needs. As a former Senior SWE on Google Gemini 's tool use team, I saw firsthand how AI would struggle with tools. If you've built AI agents, you've likely hit the same walls: (1) AI agents struggle to pick the right API from hundreds of options. (2) Tool descriptions and info consume massive token budgets. (3) Most servers cap at 40~50 tools to avoid these problems, limiting what you can build. Instead of flooding the AI with everything upfront, Strata works like a human would. It guides the AI agen

title_i18n.es: Lanzamiento HN: Strata (YC X25) – Un único servidor MCP para que la IA maneje miles de herramientas

We are Klavis AI ( https://www.klavis.ai/ ) and we're launching Strata, one open-source MCP server that helps AI agents use thousands of API tools without getting overwhelmed. Instead of showing all available tools at once, Strata reveals them step-by-step based on what the AI actually needs. As a former Senior SWE on Google Gemini 's tool use team, I saw firsthand how AI would struggle with tools. If you've built AI agents, you've likely hit the same walls: (1) AI agents struggle to pick the right API from hundreds of options. (2) Tool descriptions and info consume massive token budgets. items.title: Classifier-Free Guidance is a Predictor-Corrector
items.raw_excerpt: We investigate the theoretical foundations of classifier-free guidance (CFG). CFG is the dominant method of conditional sampling for text-to-image diffusion models, yet unlike other aspects of diffusion, it remains on shaky theoretical footing. In this paper, we disprove common misconceptions, by showing that CFG interacts differently with DDPM (Ho et al., 2020) and DDIM (Song et al., 2021), and neither sampler with CFG generates the gamma-powered distribution p(x|c)^γp(x)^{1−γ}. Then, we clarify the behavior of CFG by showing that it is a kind of predictor-corrector method (Song et al., 2020)…

items.title: AToken: A Unified Tokenizer for Vision

Specifically, we introduce a pure transformer architecture with 4D rotary position embeddings to process visual inputs of arbitrary resolutions and temporal durations. To ensure stable…

items.title: MM-Spatial: Exploring 3D Spatial Understanding in Multimodal LLMs
items.raw_excerpt: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) excel at 2D visual understanding but remain limited in their ability to reason about 3D space. Our Cubify Anything VQA (CA-VQA) data covers diverse spatial tasks including spatial relationship prediction, metric size and distance estimation, and 3D grounding. items.title: 手机秒变学习机，百度搜索正式推出 AI 伴学功能
items.raw_excerpt: 雷峰网讯 ﻿9 月 22 日，百度搜索教育新品交流会在北京中关村学说空间举办。会上正式推出 AI 伴学产品，其中包括 AI 精准练、AI 口语等重磅功能。产品入口目前集成于百度 App 内，据官方介绍，此举意在“让普通手机一键变身免费学习机，助力教育平权”。 AI 教育产品百花齐放，产品形态选择独立软件还是专门硬件，各个厂商招数不一。对于百度来说， 把教育产品集成在百度 App 内部，或许正是目前的全局最优解。 虽然是陪伴孩子，但 AI 伴学产品最初的用户往往是家长。从年龄来看，这部分人群和百度 App 的用户画像有所重合，用户迁移成本几乎为零。在此基础上，集成模块的产品形态又省去了实体学习机必然带来的硬件成本，真正实现了让家长无痛使用的产品体验。 产品功能方面，这款「学习机」除了拥有国内主流教材视频讲解、各地区小初高模拟题真题等海量优质学习资源，搭载独家的 AI 精准练、AI 口语、AI 作文批改等一系列精心打磨过的 AI 教育产品，还可以设置家长模式，实时掌控孩子的学习情况。 在 AI 伴学模式下，百度 App 首页原有的信息流会被“拍照搜题”、“在线答疑”等功能取代，且家长可通过设置密码等方式进行锁定，避免了孩子使用手机的过程中分心。 其中，AI 精准练是集「作业批改、学情分析、巩固练习 」三大能力于一体的个性化学习工具，旨在帮助孩子实现「知对错-找薄弱-促提升」的高效学习循环，支持小初高全学段、全学科题目检索，而且向家长学生全部免费开放使用。 值得一提的是，百度此前发布的数字人技术也在直播电商之外找到了新的用武之地，即此次同步推出的 AI 口语功能。 据介绍，为了打磨这些 AI 功能，百度教育团队专门研发了一套更聪明、更高效的模型，依托文心 4.5、DeepSeek 等底座大模型、百度文本检索引擎及自建知识图谱，实现了全流程智能化、个性化、精准化。 雷峰网文章

excerpt_i18n.en:
On September 22, Leifeng News reported that Baidu Search held an education product launch event at the Xue Shuo Space in Beijing's Zhongguancun, officially introducing its AI learning companion product. Key features include AI Precision Practice and AI Speaking. The product is currently integrated within the Baidu App, with the official aim to "turn an ordinary smartphone into a free learning device with one click, promoting educational equity." 

In the flourishing AI education market, approaches vary—some opt for standalone software, others for dedicated hardware. For Baidu, integrating the education product into its app appears to be the optimal current strategy. While designed to accompany children, the initial users are often parents, whose demographic aligns with Baidu App's user base, minimizing migration costs. This integrated approach also avoids the hardware expenses of physical learning devices, offering a seamless experience for parents.

Functionally, the "learning device" provides extensive resources like video explanations aligned with national textbooks and practice exams for primary to high school levels across regions. It incorporates exclusive AI tools such as Precision Practice, Speaking, and Essay Grading, along with a parent mode for real-time monitoring of children's progress. In AI companion mode, the Baidu App homepage replaces its usual feed with features like "Photo Search for Answers" and "Online Q&A," allowing parents to oversee learning activities.
excerpt_i18n.es: El 22 de septiembre, Leifeng Wang informó que la conferencia de intercambio sobre nuevos productos educativos de Búsqueda de Baidu se celebró en el Espacio de Aprendizaje de Zhongguancun, Beijing. En el evento se lanzó oficialmente el producto de acompañamiento educativo con IA, que incluye funciones destacadas como Práctica Precisa con IA y Práctica Oral con IA. La entrada al producto está actualmente integrada en la aplicación de Baidu. Según la descripción oficial, el objetivo es "transformar un teléfono común en una herramienta de aprendizaje gratuita con un solo clic, promoviendo la igualdad educativa". Los productos educativos con IA están floreciendo, y cada fabricante elige diferentes enfoques, ya sea como software independiente o hardware especializado. Para Baidu, integrar el producto educativo dentro de su aplicación parece ser la solución óptima actual. Aunque está diseñado para acompañar a los niños, la IA

items.title: 全球AI云战场开打： 微软云、AWS 向左，谷歌、阿里云向右
items.raw_excerpt: 最近，几乎每位出差的人都会有同感：“北上广的机场核心位置，几乎被各大 AI 云厂商占满了！” 在云计算的赛道上，AI 云已经成为新一轮的入场券。它不仅关乎算力，更决定厂商能否摆脱价格战泥潭、重建护城河，以及在全球科技牌桌上争得一席之地。因此，过去两年里，国内云厂商在战略、组织等各个环节都全力投入，争夺市场领先地位的竞争愈发激烈，“第一”的争夺成为行业关注的核心。 对于大厂来说，“AI 云第一”不仅是数字排名，更是一种行业认可和市场号召力。谁能贴上这个标签，谁就更容易吸引客户、赢得市场份额。 但如果把眼光放宽点，在全球范围内，AI云的竞争格局更激烈，如今只剩4朵超级AI云：美国的AWS、微软和谷歌，以及中国的阿里云。 AI云不等于模型调用 谁是 AI 云 “第一”？取决于评判标准。不同群体基于不同视角，答案也各不相同。 有部分人认为，模型是评判AI云第一的核心要素。 理由也很简单，企业最终是要用模型来解决问题的，客户会用脚投票。尤其是在当下，很多公司都陷入了“AI焦虑”，迫切希望模型能真正帮上忙。谁的模型能不断迭代升级，在不同场景里都能答得准、算得快、还能带来新思路，谁就更容易在AI云的竞争中脱颖而出。 火山引擎所强调的“调用量”，其实也是这一逻辑的延伸——通过高频调用，来侧面证明其模型的成熟度与市场接受度。 但雷峰网认为，如果从市场规模上看，以模型调用为主的MaaS市场，远比不上千亿级别的云计算市场。更重要的是，如果从长远来看，随着AI应用进入更深层次的产业化阶段，要构建一朵真正的超级AI云，仅靠模型表现远远不够。 这就像一座大厦，地基坚实、结构完整，才能在风雨中稳固屹立，并为未来扩建和升级提供可靠支撑。因此，未来要真正评估谁才是AI 云第一，必须经历这四大硬核拷问： 第一，每年是否有千亿级的基础设施投入？ AI云真正的门槛不是宣传口号，而是实打实的资金实力。今年头部云厂商

title_i18n.zh: 全球AI云战场开打： 微软云、AWS 向左，谷歌、阿里云向右
title_i18n.en: The global AI cloud battle begins: Microsoft Cloud and AWS go left, while Google and Alibaba Cloud go right.
title_i18n.es: El campo de batalla global de la IA en la nube comienza: Microsoft Cloud y AWS hacia la izquierda, Google y Alibaba Cloud hacia la derecha.

excerpt_i18n.zh: 最近，几乎每位出差的人都会有同感：“北上广的机场核心位置，几乎被各大 AI 云厂商占满了！” 在云计算的赛道上，AI 云已经成为新一轮的入场券。它不仅关乎算力，更决定厂商能否摆脱价格战泥潭、重建护城河，以及在全球科技牌桌上争得一席之地。因此，过去两年里，国内云厂商在战略、组织等各个环节都全力投入，争夺市场领先地位的竞争愈发激烈，“第一”的争夺成为行业关注的核心。 对于大厂来说，“AI 云第一”不仅是数字排名，更是一种行业认可和市场号召力。谁能贴上这个标签，谁就更容易吸引客户、赢得市场份额。 但如果把眼光放宽点，在全球范围内，AI云的竞争格局更激烈，如今只剩4朵超级AI云：美国的AWS、微软和谷歌，以及中国的阿里云。 AI云不等于模型调用 谁是 AI 云 “第一”？取决于评判标准。不同群体基于不同视角，答案也各不相同。 有部分人认为，模型是评判AI云第一的核心要素。 理由也很简单，企业最终是要用模型来解决问题的，客户会用脚投票。尤其是在当下，很多公司都陷入了“AI焦虑”，迫切希望模型能真正帮上忙。谁的模型能不断迭代升级，在不同场景里都能答得准、算得快、还能带来新思路，谁就更容易在AI云的竞争中脱颖而出。 火山引擎所强调的“调用量”，其实也是这一逻辑的延伸——通过高频调用，来侧面证明其模型的成熟度与市场接受度。 但雷峰网认为，如果从市场规模上看，以模型调用为主的MaaS市场，远比不上千亿级别的云计算市场。更重要的是，如果从长远来看，随着AI应用进入更深层次的产业化阶段，要构建一朵真正的超级AI云，仅靠模型表现远远不够。 这就像一座大厦，地基坚实、结构完整，才能在风雨中稳固屹立，并为未来扩建和升级提供可靠支撑。因此，未来要真正评估谁才是AI 云第一，必须经历这四大硬核拷问： 第一，每年是否有千亿级的基础设施投入？ AI云真正的门槛不是宣传口号，而是实打实的资金实力。今年头部云厂商
excerpt_i18n.en: Recently, almost every business traveler would agree: "The prime advertising spaces in Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou airports are overwhelmingly dominated by major AI cloud providers!" In the race for cloud computing, AI cloud has become the new entry ticket. It not only concerns computing power but also determines whether providers can escape the price war, rebuild their competitive moats, and secure a place at the global tech table. Consequently, over the past two years, domestic cloud providers have invested heavily in strategy, organization, and every other aspect, intensifying the competition for market leadership, with the battle for "first place" becoming the industry's focal point. For major players, being "number one in AI cloud" is not just a numerical ranking but also an industry endorsement and market influence. Whoever earns this label finds it easier to attract clients and gain market share. However, broadening the perspective globally, the competition in AI cloud is even fiercer, now narrowed down to four super AI clouds: AWS, Microsoft, and Google from the U.S., along with China's Alibaba Cloud. AI cloud is not just about model access. Who is "first" in AI cloud? It depends on the criteria. Different groups, from different viewpoints, have varying answers. Some believe the model is the core factor in judging AI cloud leadership. The reasoning is straightforward: businesses ultimately use models to solve problems, and clients vote with their feet. Especially now, many companies are experiencing "AI anxiety," urgently hoping models can genuinely assist. Whose models can continuously iterate and upgrade, delivering accurate, fast responses across various scenarios while offering fresh insights, will more likely lead in the AI cloud arena.
excerpt_i18n.es: Últimamente, casi todo el que viaja por trabajo comparte una sensación: "¡Las zonas clave de los aeropuertos de Beijing, Shanghai y Guangzhou están copadas por los principales proveedores de nube de IA!" En la carrera de la computación en la nube, la nube de IA se ha convertido en la nueva entrada al juego. No solo se trata de capacidad de cálculo, sino que determina si los proveedores pueden escapar de la guerra de precios, reconstruir su ventaja competitiva y ganar un lugar en la mesa global de tecnología. Por eso, en los últimos dos años, los proveedores nacionales de nube han invertido a fondo en todos los aspectos, desde la estrategia hasta la organización, y la competencia por el liderazgo del mercado se ha intensificado. La lucha por ser el "número uno" se ha convertido en el centro de atención de la industria. Para los grandes actores, ser el "número uno en nube de IA" no es solo una clasificación numérica, sino un reconocimiento del sector y un poder de convocatoria en el mercado.

items.title: 硅基流动入局企业级 MaaS，重写大模型落地叙事
items.raw_excerpt: 2025 年，AI 大模型已从“概念验证”走到“价值兑现”的关键阶段。 越来越多企业开始思考：大模型不仅要能用，还要真正带来业务效率的提升与成本的可控。在这一背景下，硅基流动推出了企业级 MaaS平台。 作为覆盖算力纳管、模型训练、推理部署到场景应用的全链路解决方案，回应了大模型产业化落地的五大核心矛盾：适配速度、性能与成本、可靠性、质量、以及安全合规。不仅帮企业解决了落地过程中的关键挑战，更为产业提供了一套能够规模化复制的智能基础设施。   破解大模型落地的五大挑战 大模型的产业化进程中，企业普遍面临模型适配、推理性能与成本、服务可靠性、输出质量和安全合规等五大挑战。硅基流动的企业级 MaaS 平台，正是针对这些痛点，提供了系统性的解法： 快速引入，一键部署：预集成 100+ 主流开源与闭源大模型，结合多种算力卡推理加速包，实现开箱即用。依托硅基流动公有云能力，新模型最快可在 1–3 天内完成适配并同步至企业私有环境，大幅缩短上线周期。 高性能与低成本兼顾：通过智能路由、自研推理框架和动态扩缩容，实现性能与成本的最优平衡。上下文感知、KV Cache 感知、LoRA 感知等策略，加上算子优化、显存管理与量化加速，大幅提升吞吐并降低延迟。 高可靠与可观测：支持多集群容灾与无缝故障切换，保障服务持续稳定；多维度监控能力则覆盖模型性能、资源使用和业务指标，实现精细化治理。 测评驱动的质量优化：内置测评工具链，支持自定义测评集与结果比对，帮助企业完成模型选型与 Prompt 优化，同时支持一键调优和 Multi-LoRA 推理，进一步节省资源。 企业级安全与合规：通过多租户数据隔离、细粒度权限管控和全链路日志审计，为企业提供全方位的安全与合规保障。 这套能力组合，让企业能够高效、稳定、安全地拥抱大模型技术，并实现规模化落地。 从“试点成功”到“规模化应用” 过

excerpt_i18n.en:
By 2025, AI large models have entered a critical phase of transitioning from "proof of concept" to "value realization." More and more enterprises are beginning to consider that large models must not only be usable but also genuinely enhance business efficiency and ensure controllable costs. In this context, Silicon-based Flow has launched an enterprise-grade MaaS platform. As an end-to-end solution covering computing resource management, model training, inference deployment, and scenario applications, it addresses the five core challenges in the industrialization of large models: adaptation speed, performance versus cost, reliability, quality, and security compliance. It not only helps enterprises overcome key hurdles in implementation but also provides the industry with a scalable and replicable intelligent infrastructure. 

Addressing the Five Major Challenges in Large Model Deployment
In the industrialization of large models, enterprises commonly face five challenges: model adaptation, inference performance and cost, service reliability, output quality, and security compliance. Silicon-based Flow's enterprise MaaS platform offers systematic solutions tailored to these pain points:

- Rapid Integration, One-Click Deployment: Pre-integrated with 100+ mainstream open-source and proprietary large models, combined with various computing card inference acceleration packages, enabling out-of-the-box usability. Leveraging Silicon-based Flow's public cloud capabilities, new models can be adapted and synchronized to private enterprise environments in as little as 1–3 days, significantly shortening deployment cycles.

- Balancing High Performance and Low Cost: Achieves optimal balance between performance and cost through intelligent routing, proprietary inference frameworks, and dynamic scaling. Features include context awareness, KV Cache awareness, and LoRA.
excerpt_i18n.es: En 2025, los grandes modelos de IA han entrado en una fase crucial, pasando de la "prueba de concepto" a la "materialización de valor". Cada vez más empresas reflexionan: los grandes modelos no solo deben ser utilizables, sino que también deben mejorar realmente la eficiencia empresarial y controlar los costes. En este contexto, Silica Flow ha lanzado una plataforma MaaS empresarial. Como solución integral que abarca desde la gestión de la potencia computacional, el entrenamiento de modelos, el despliegue de inferencias hasta las aplicaciones prácticas, responde a las cinco contradicciones clave de la industrialización de los grandes modelos: velocidad de adaptación, rendimiento y coste, fiabilidad, calidad, y seguridad y cumplimiento normativo. No solo ayuda a las empresas a resolver los desafíos críticos durante la implementación, sino que también proporciona a la industria una infraestructura inteligente escalable y replicable.
